Information about the position

Politecnico di Milano is seeking candidates with strong research potential, interested in developing new tools for minimally invasive cancer treatment with laser. The research project focuses on the development of a FEM-based simulation for the optimization of minimally invasive laser procedures for cancer treatment. The model will drive the planning of the clinical procedure, based on the simulation of the temporal evolution of the temperature distribution within the target tissue. Segmentation of the 3D geometry of the patientâs anatomy will be obtained from MR medical images.

It is required experience in FEM for biomechanical applications, and knowledge of Comsol Multiphysics and, preferably, Materialise Mimics.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on a unique interdisciplinary project, in cooperation with medical partners and an active and international research team.

The project will be carried out in the Department of Mechanical Engineering (DMEC) of Politecnico di Milano.

The position is funded by the ERC Starting Grant âLaser Ablation: SElectivity and monitoRing for OPTImal tuMor removalâ.
